label: Behavior 44176436
summary: Vessel behavior pattern: navigating along a fixed route (the persistent alignment between COG and heading, combined with stable speed and negligible course deviation, indicates the vessel is following a straight, predefined maritime route; the position progression follows a linear trajectory moving south-southeast, approximated by the parametric equations: lat(t) ≈ 55.4412 − 0.00066 × t, lon(t) ≈ 4.4088 − 0.000024 × t, where t is normalized time index from 0 to 1 over the observed segment)
description: Speed profile: stable (the vessel maintains a nearly constant speed around 13.0–13.1 knots, indicating steady propulsion and no acceleration or deceleration phases)

Course change: gradual and consistent (COG varies slightly between 180.5° and 182.4°, showing a smooth, sustained southward progression with minor adjustments, typical of navigation along a defined corridor)
Heading fluctuation: stable (heading remains fixed at either 179.0° or 180.0°, with only one observation at 181.0°, indicating minimal yaw and precise directional control)

Behavior intent: navigating along a fixed route (the persistent alignment between COG and heading, combined with stable speed and negligible course deviation, indicates the vessel is following a straight, predefined maritime route; the position progression follows a linear trajectory moving south-southeast, approximated by the parametric equations: lat(t) ≈ 55.4412 − 0.00066 × t, lon(t) ≈ 4.4088 − 0.000024 × t, where t is normalized time index from 0 to 1 over the observed segment)
